meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a fact.
meanings.sent1: The facticity of the statement was undeniable.
meanings.sent2: She always valued facticity over speculation.
meanings.sent3: The facticity of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His argument lacked facticity, floating in a sea of opinions.
meanings.sent5: The facticity of the evidence left no room for doubt.

meanings.definition: The fact or quality of being actual or real.
meanings.sent1: The facticity of his experience was unquestionable.
meanings.sent2: They were amazed by the facticity of the historical artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The facticity of the magic trick left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: In the world of dreams, facticity often takes a back seat.
meanings.sent5: The facticity of the sunrise painted the sky with truth.
